sub_title: Enterprise Information Management | Project Management | Records Management | Compliance
summary:
Extensive experience in helping customers with their digital transformation journey. Specialized in optimizing business processes via content enrichment and deep integration with SAP. Certified in OpenText Content Suite and OpenText Extended Enterprise Content Management (xECM).

Prefer to operate in a role as liaison between business and IT. Defining vision, strategies and roadmap, and the ability to execute in a role as project manager with a hands-on mentality, managing teams of 5-10 consultants and subcontractors. Experienced in leading multicultural teams in Europe and across South-East Asia. Commercial sensitive and driving presales solutioning activities for opportunities of €500k. Certified SCRUM master (PSM I). Getting satisfaction from coaching and knowledge sharing.

Wide industry exposure with focus on Oil & Gas, Petrochemicals, Utilities, Insurance; next to Chemicals, Pharmaceuticals, Aviation, Advertising, Transport & Distribution, Warehousing, Commodity Trading, Accounting, and Industrial Automation.

Certified in Microsoft Azure, and hands-on experience with Amazon AWS and Google Cloud Platform (GCP).

Experimenting with 3D printing and programming as a hobby.

contributors.headline: Enterprise Information Management | Project Management | Records Management | Compliance

projects.title: OpenText ECM at BDO (SG)
projects.description:
BDO LLP in Singapore is a member firm of BDO International and offers a range of services, including audit, corporate finance, business restructuring, tax advisory, management consulting and risk advisory.

BDO Singapore has selected OpenText Content Suite Platform to better manage their corporate documents, to securely store them, and to dispose of them at the end of their lifecycle. In addition, the solution was selected to eliminate bottlenecks in document review and approval.

In this project a role as project manager and solution architect was fulfilled, managing an implementation team of 2-3 consultants.

The implementation covered 19 departments, for each establishing a taxonomy, designation-based permission model, and document retention settings. Review and approval workflows were defined and various ways of digitizing documents and making them searchable were configured.

IT department was enabled to maintain the solution, support users, and to further roll-out the solution to other departments and migrate their documents into OpenText Content Suite.

Software Developer | OT xECM | Documentum | OT Intelligent Capture | MS Azure

projects.title: SAP xECM at Singapore Police Force (SG)
projects.description:
Singapore Police Force (SPF) is the main government agency tasked with maintaining law and order in Singapore.

SPF has selected OpenText Extended ECM to optimize SAP processes by making key documents available within the SAP transactions and to allow collaboration between SAP- and non-SAP users, also leveraging on Microsoft SharePoint's user-interface.

In this project a role as Solution Architect was fulfilled.

The integration with OpenText Extended ECM was sub-contracted from another System Integrator with a limited number of undefined SAP Objects to be integrated via OpenText Document Access and OpenText Extended ECM. In a series of workshops, various integration scenarios were discussed in-depth until agreement on the integration and design of the Business Workspaces was reached.

Juris Doctor Student | Project Manager & Tech Consultant
Partner Delivery Manager - APAC  at SAP  | Driving Customer Success

projects.title: SAP xECM at Nan Shan Life (TW)
projects.description:
Nan Shan Life Insurance offers life, health, medical, property, and other insurance services to customers in Taiwan.

For the replacement of their existing AS/400 system, Nan Shan has selected SAP as their new ERP system, integrated with OpenText Extended ECM to optimize SAP processes and enable collaboration between SAP- and non-SAP users, and integrated with SAP Document Presentment as Output Management solution, and also integrated with OpenText Extended ECM.

In this project a role as Solution Architect was fulfilled.

The integration with OpenText Extended ECM and SAP Document Presentment was sub­contracted from SAP. Due to the complexity of customizations on SAP-side, and volume of transactions, integration had to be established via a middle layer of Web Services, rather than leveraging on the out-of-the-box integration capabilities. As solution architect, high-performing building blocks for specific integration functions were defined, that were then consumed from ABAP side and by Fiore Apps.

projects.title: Alchemy Document migration at Carigali Hess (MY)
projects.description:
Carigali Hess is a Kuala-Lumpur-based joint venture Oil & Gas company between PCJDA and Hess Oil Company, engaged in gas production in disputed waters off the coast of Kota Bahru, and administered by the Malaysian-Thailand Joint Authority (MTJA).

Carigali Hess was using Alchemy as document repository for their Engineering documents. Alchemy is end-of-life and supported on best-effort basis only. Carigali Hess has decided to migrate these Engineering documents into OpenText Extended ECM and decommission the Alchemy solution.

In this project a role as Project Manager was fulfilled, managing and coaching one analyst in the migration and validation of 50.000 documents and 0.5 million folders.

Digital Consultant | ECM Functional Specialist

projects.title: Records Management at Sarawak Energy Berhad (MY)
projects.description:
Sarawak Energy Berhad is the Malaysian energy company based in Kuching. The company is responsible for the generation, transmission and distribution of electricity for the state of Sarawak in Malaysia and has about 600,000 customers. The company is wholly owned by the State Government.

Sarawak Energy has selected OpenText Content Suite as corporate Records Management solution, initially for Legal, Project Execution, Thermal, People & Leadership, Research & Development and IT Services departments.

In this project a role as Project Manager, Solution Architect and Business Consultant was fulfilled, managing an implementation team of 3 technical - and 4 functional consultants.

The implementation was done concurrently with a business function-focused file classification project by a Business Consulting firm. With classifications for new functions becoming ready during the project, and existing functions being modified, the project required an iterative implementation approach. Existing electronic records were migrated into ECM. Physical records in the corporate records room, as well as in departmental records rooms were configured in OpenText Physical Items. The fresh SEB Records Manager was familiarized with Records Management principles, and how these were implemented in OpenText. SEB's Lotus Notes team was enabled in the conversion of legacy Lotus Notes applications to form- and workflow-based solutions in OpenText.

Project Manager at Delaware Consulting BeLux

projects.title: SAP xECM at BUNGE Agriculture (SG)
projects.description:
Bunge Asia provides trading of agricultural commodities. The Company markets and supplies grain, dry beans, soybeans, crops, oilseeds, fertilizers, edible oils, sugar, and other products for customers worldwide.

Bunge has selected OpenText Extended ECM for compliance purposes and for optimization of its Contract Generation and - Execution processes.

In this project a role as Project Manager, Solution Architect and Lead Expert was fulfilled, managing one technical and two functional consultants.

For food commodities, bulk shipments are sourced from different suppliers and sold to multiple customers. Full traceability of the food chain is required and is a prerequisite for invoicing. In OpenText Extended ECM a solution of related Business Workspaces was created to store relevant certificates from suppliers, shippers, etc.. Documents were distributed to customers whereby ownership could change, or be split, while products were still in transit. Using dashboards and reporting, completeness of required documentation was monitored, allowing timely availability of all relevant contract information, and expediting invoicing.

For Contracts department, a form-based solution was developed to semi-automatic generate commercial sales and purchase contracts, and have them internally approved via OpenText workflow. Barcodes were added to contracts, allowing them to be automatically filed into OpenText Extended ECM upon scanning of the counter-signed document.

contributors.headline: Enterprise Information Management | Project Management | Records Management | Compliance
Presales Manager at Hexagon ALI
Product manager at OMP

projects.title: SAP xECM at Carigali Hess (MY)
projects.description:
Carigali Hess is a Kuala-Lumpur-based joint venture Oil & Gas company between PCJDA and Hess Oil Company, engaged in gas production in disputed waters off the coast of Kota Bahru, and administered by the Malaysian-Thailand Joint Authority (MTJA).

Carigali Hess has selected OpenText Extended ECM to optimize its Contracting & Procurement, Production Operations, and Human Resources business processes, later to be expanded to Engineering and other business processes, and as Document Management solution for the Enterprise.

In this project a role as Project Manager, Solution Architect and Lead Expert was fulfilled, managing an implementation team of 9 consultants.

For Contracting & Procurement OpenText Extended ECM was implemented. For the Procure-to-Pay process, business workspaces were designed and created. Workflows were developed to support the procurement review and approval processes.

For Production Operation, the Management of Change process was implemented with an OpenText form-based workflow solution. By shifting from a paper-based process to an electronic process, hereby allowing approvals to be obtained electronically, and in parallel, the Management of Change process was significantly expedited. Upon final confirmation, the Management of Change form was generated and the corresponding change order via BAPI in SAP created.

For Human Resources department, personnel files were created, and hardcopy P-files were digitized. Workflows were implemented for review- and approval processes, and for recruitment, on-boarding, and off-boarding of staff.

projects.title: Claim Handling at ACR (SG)
projects.description:
Asia Capital Reinsurance is a Singapore-based reinsurance company and is ranked among the world's top 50 reinsurers.

ACR has selected OpenText Extended ECM as document repository for its SAP implementation and as solution for claims management.

In this project a role as Solution Architect and Lead Expert was fulfilled. One functional consultant was managed to support UAT and transition to production.

The company had implemented a claim handling process, using OpenText workflows, to approve/reject submitted claims. Documents are stored in OpenText xECM and are integrated with SAP FS-RI to support claim handling processes. Changes to the authorization matrix required revision of the OpenText workflows. Consolidating own assignments and initiated workflows into a "My-Claims" page improved visibility of claims and outstanding tasks to claims handlers.

Digital Experience Platform (DXP) Enablement Lead at Bose Corporation

projects.title: SAP xECM at MSIG (SG)
projects.description:
MSIG Holding (Asia) is one of Asia’s leading general insurers, with presence in Singapore for over 100 years. It is a member of the MS&AD Group, one of the world’s largest general insurance groups with operations in more than 40 countries. MSIG offers a wide range of insurance solutions for travel, motor, health and home.

For the replacement of their existing AS/400 system, MSIG has selected SAP as their new ERP system, integrated with OpenText Extended ECM to optimize SAP processes and enable collaboration between SAP- and non-SAP users, and integrated with SAP Document Presentment as Output Management solution, and also integrated with OpenText Extended ECM.

In this project a role as Project Manager and Lead Expert was fulfilled, heading an implementation team of 4 consultants.

The integration with OpenText Extended ECM was outsourced by MSIG's SAP implementation partner. The project implemented an OpenText Extended ECM prototyping environment to facilitate in end-to-end use-case requirements validation for SAP FS-RI from 7 business units across 5 Asian countries.

Singapore Power has selected SAP Extended ECM for Document Access and Archiving.

A five day, hands-on training course was given to familiarize IT staff with the concepts of OpenText ECM and xECM and to demonstrate the capabilities of the solution.

projects.title: Feasibility Study SAP-integrated ECM Solution at Carigali Hess (MY)
projects.description:
Carigali Hess is a Kuala-Lumpur-based joint venture Oil & Gas company between PCJDA and Hess Oil Company, engaged in gas production in disputed waters off the coast of Kota Bahru, and administered by the Malaysian-Thailand Joint Authority (MTJA).

A feasibility study and ROI analysis was performed, identifying key business requirements for a to-be-selected SAP-integrated ECM solution.

contributors.headline: Enterprise Information Management | Project Management | Records Management | Compliance

projects.title: ECM at Yokogawa (NL)
projects.description:
Yokogawa is a leading provider of Industrial Automation and Test and Measurement solutions. Combining technology with engineering services, project management, and maintenance, Yokogawa delivers field proven operational efficiency, safety, quality, and reliability.

As Application Manager ECM, a number of initiatives were implemented, managing one functional and technical employee.

Legal department was lacking insight in the company’s contracts and was unable to timely report to Japan. An OpenText Content Server solution for Contracts Management was implemented that provided scanning and filing functionality for contract owners. Using barcodes, contracts were automatically scanned to the correct location in ECM. Leveraging on the defined metadata, cross-departmental reporting was generated to meet reporting requirements from Japan. Contract owners benefited from the solution via contract expiration and renewal monitoring.

For Corporate Marketing department, corporate digital assets lacked usability due to their file format, causing significant workload in user support. A Corporate Image Library solution was built in OpenText Content Server, providing thumbnails and JPG versions for all images.

For QHSE department, findings from a Lloyd’s audit required implementation of a Quality Management System in order to prolong ISO certification. A QMS was developed on OpenText Content Server, containing all procedures, work instructions, and templates. End-users benefitted from the solution by presenting them only with relevant QMS documents. Quality Coordinators across Europe were given delegated responsibilities in maintaining country-specific additions, with workflow-enabled approval.

For Engineering department, control, risk, and legal and financial impact due to late completion of project deliverables had to be improved. A Transmittal Management solution was built on OpenText Content Server, leveraging on metadata and workflow capabilities.

contributors.headline: Enterprise Information Management | Project Management | Records Management | Compliance

projects.title: Portfolio Planner and Records Manager at Shell Exploration & Production (NL)
projects.description:
Shell International Exploration and Production operates as an Oil & Gas company. The Company provides exploration, extraction, and processing of gas, oil, and other products. Shell International Exploration and Production serves clients worldwide.

In this role the Document and Records Management (DRM) application portfolio was managed for Shell EP by making sure required business functionalities are covered by single, Microsoft Vista compatible applications.

At EPT-IT the RM implementation is linked to the replacement of the current ECM system. The main objectives of this role are to obtain buy-in from business stakeholders for the worldwide replacement of ECM in EPT-IT and to manage the project with a primary focus on business interests. Records Management compliance is ensured by interfacing to Shell’s TRIM Records Management application.

contributors.headline: Enterprise Information Management | Project Management | Records Management | Compliance

projects.title: Paper-independent Office and Records Management at SABIC (NL/UK)
projects.description:
SABIC Europe is a subsidiary of Saudi Basic Industries Corporation (SABIC), based in Riyad, Saudi Arabia. SABIC is the Middle East's largest petrochemicals company and worldwide number-four player in polyolefins. In addition, SABIC is active in chemicals, fertilizers, and metals. SABIC Europe is responsible for all SABIC activities in Europe.

SABIC has introduced a new way of working that allowed staff to work independent of person, location and paper in an open office environment. To support this concept, a new European state-of-the art head-office was built. OpenText Content Server was selected as solution for Document Management, Collaboration, and Records Management.

In this project roles as Project Manager and Functional Consultant were fulfilled, managing an implementation team of 5-6 consultants. 

OpenText Content Server with Records Management was implemented for all departments in SABIC's new head-office and production plants, as well as in its sales office in Europe. Concepts for publishing, collaboration, authorization and records management were designed and implemented. System usage was measured against the objectives of SABIC’s new way of working and departments were actively engaged to improve system usage.

projects.title: Collaboration in Virtual Teams at Shell Exploration & Production (NL)
projects.description:
Shell International Exploration and Production operates as an Oil & Gas company. The Company provides exploration, extraction, and processing of gas, oil, and other products. Shell International Exploration and Production serves clients worldwide.

As Information Management Consultant, Document Life Cycle Management was introduced. Important business records were identified and subsequently published. Document types were identified and associated with business processes.

An Information Management Data Warehouse was created, containing usage and performance information from different Livelink systems. This data was made available via a website, using XML and web technology (ASP). Document management procedures were supported by a.o. visualizing access control and activity to Livelink areas. At the same time, Livelink was rolled out to new teams, mainly for collaboration with third party staff outside Shell.

As functional consultant, the Virtual Teams module for Livelink was implemented. The taxonomy for Livelink was created, adhering to international industry standards. Procedures regarding export regulations (GEC) were established. Users have been trained in individual sessions and with the Centra online e-learning tool. Modifications to Livelink were defined and implemented. A Business Support Desk was set-up.

contributors.headline: Enterprise Information Management | Project Management | Records Management | Compliance

projects.title: ECM Support Manager at Logica (NL)
projects.description:
CMG (Computer Management Group) was a consulting company focused on telecommunications and computing and based in London, United Kingdom. It was once a constituent of the FTSE 100 Index until it merged with Logica in 2002, which became a wholly owned subsidiary of CGI Group in 2012.

At CMG, OpenText Livelink was internally used as Knowledge Management system. Functional and Technical Application Maintenance was done by an internal support/development team.

In this role, the support/development team of 5-7 employees was managed. The quality of support was improved and professionalized by establishing work procedures and by simplifying time-consuming and complex processes. A self-service help system was introduced for end-users. SLA’s have been defined. Standards for programming and documentation were established. Progress and budget were monitored. Reporting was done to the responsible Intranet manager.

For Production Operation, the Management of Change process was implemented with an OpenText form-based workflow solution. By shifting from a paper-based process to an electronic process, hereby allowing approvals to be obtained electronically, and in parallel, the Management of Change process was significantly expedited. Upon final confirmation, the Management of Change form was generated and the corresponding change order via BAPI in SAP created.

For Human Resources department, personnel files were created, and hardcopy P-files were digitized. Workflows were implemented for review- and approval processes, and for recruitment, on-boarding, and off-boarding of staff.
profile_positions.title: Solution Architect / Lead Expert / Project Manager at Carigalli Hess

profile_positions.description:
Asia Capital Reinsurance is a Singapore-based reinsurance company and is ranked among the world's top 50 reinsurers.

ACR has selected OpenText Extended ECM as document repository for its SAP implementation and as solution for claims management.

In this project a role as Solution Architect and Lead Expert was fulfilled. One functional consultant was managed to support UAT and transition to production.

The company had implemented a claim handling process, using OpenText workflows, to approve/reject submitted claims. Documents are stored in OpenText xECM and are integrated with SAP FS-RI to support claim handling processes. Changes to the authorization matrix required revision of the OpenText workflows. Consolidating own assignments and initiated workflows into a "My-Claims" page improved visibility of claims and outstanding tasks to claims handlers.
profile_positions.title: Solution Architect / Project Manager / Lead Expert at Asia Capital Reinsurance (ACR)

profile_positions.description:
Subcontracted by MSG Global
MSIG Holding (Asia) is one of Asia’s leading general insurers, with presence in Singapore for over 100 years. It is a member of the MS&AD Group, one of the world’s largest general insurance groups with operations in more than 40 countries. MSIG offers a wide range of insurance solutions for travel, motor, health and home.

For the replacement of their existing AS/400 system, MSIG has selected SAP as their new ERP system, integrated with OpenText Extended ECM to optimize SAP processes and enable collaboration between SAP- and non-SAP users, and integrated with SAP Document Presentment as Output Management solution, and also integrated with OpenText Extended ECM.

In this project a role as Project Manager and Lead Expert was fulfilled, heading an implementation team of 4 consultants.

The integration with OpenText Extended ECM was outsourced by MSIG's SAP implementation partner. The project implemented an OpenText Extended ECM prototyping environment to facilitate in end-to-end use-case requirements validation for SAP FS-RI from 7 business units across 5 Asian countries.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager / Solution Architect at Mitsui Sumitomo Insurance Group (MSIG)

profile_positions.description:
Singapore Power is a government-owned electricity and gas distribution company in Singapore.

Singapore Power has selected SAP Extended ECM for Document Access and Archiving.

A five day, hands-on training course was given to familiarize IT staff with the concepts of OpenText ECM and xECM and to demonstrate the capabilities of the solution.
profile_positions.title: Lead Expert at a Singapore Power

profile_positions.location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
profile_positions.description:
Carigali Hess is a Kuala-Lumpur-based joint venture Oil & Gas company between PCJDA and Hess Oil Company, engaged in gas production in disputed waters off the coast of Kota Bahru, and administered by the Malaysian-Thailand Joint Authority (MTJA).

A feasibility study and ROI analysis was performed, identifying key business requirements for a to-be-selected SAP-integrated ECM solution.
profile_positions.title: Senior Business Consultant OpenText at Carigalli Hess

profile_positions.description:
As Project Manager and Application Manager for the Implementation of OpenText ECM at Yokogawa Europe, I have introduced document management and knowledge management functionality to 2.000 users in 30 offices in Europe and Africa and enabling collaboration with 20.000 users in the Yokogawa group.

I have established seamless integration with the Yokogawa Intranet as platform for knowledge sharing and as a platform to share official published and released documents. Using vanila ECM, without any additional modules, I have implement business specific solutions for quality management, digital asset management, contract management and transmittal management in engineering projects. With the geographic spread of the offices accross Europe, I have empowered users to adopt the OpenText solutions by providing an e-Learning training curriculum.
profile_positions.title: Application Manager ECM

profile_positions.description:
From 1996 until 2001, I have worked as Project Leader and AS/400 System Analyst/Programmer at Initiative Media, KLM, Food-Express, Lyondell and DSM Gist on a.o. millennium and Euro conversion projects.

In 2001 I changed focus to ECM systems and lead the OpenText ECM support desk and development team at CMG (later: LogicaCMG, Logica, CGI). Later roles include Information Management Consultant, Portfolio Planner, Project Manager and Business Project Manager. I have successfully implemented OpenText-based solutions for working in virtual teams, paper-independent office and records management at Shell Eexploration and Production, and at SABIC Europe.
